item.title: Git LFS and Github Free Tier
item.description: TL;DR: Just don’t! Git, binary files, and LFS Storing binary files directly in git is something you might be interested in doing, but it wasn’t really designed for that purpose to begin with. Git is good at versioning text files, not binaries! In short: Git by default doesn’t generate diffs for binaries and versions the complete history for each file, which will cause your .git folder to explode in size over time.
